snippet: Officials in the state where Robert Stackowitz fled from prison nearly 50 years ago have agreed to grant him a medical reprieve, sparing him from going back to serve the rest of his sentence....
abstract: Georgia's Board of Pardons and Paroles grants medical reprieve to fugitive Robert Stackowitz, who was convicted of robbery by force in 1966, and allows him to remain in Sherman, Conn, where he has lived nearly 50 years since escaping prison; requests he be kept under supervision until end of his sentence in 2022.
lead_paragraph: Officials in the state where Robert Stackowitz fled from prison nearly 50 years ago have agreed to grant him a medical reprieve, sparing him from going back to serve the rest of his sentence.

headline.main: Georgia Won’t Force Fugitive, 71, Back From Connecticut to Finish His Term
headline.print_headline: Fugitive, 71, Won’t Be Forced to Return to Prison in Georgia
